titles.title: To designate the United States courthouse located at 40 Centre Street in New York, New York, as the "Thurgood Marshall United States Courthouse".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 107-166.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 61.

action.text: Mr. LaTourette asked unanimous consent to discharge the House Calendar and consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.subcommittee: Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management
committee.name: House Transportation and Infrastructure

bill.summary: 7/26/2001--Reported to House without amendment. Designates the U.S. Courthouse located at 40 Centre Street in New York, New York, as the Thurgood Marshall United States Courthouse.
